answers.answer: I can understand your disappointment, but it has nothing to do with you being a failure. Maybe something will happen between now and then. I was desperate to have my daughter when I was 40 weeks. I went on a walk for a mile, the last 50 yards I started jogging and boom my water broke. Had her the next day. Lol.

With my 1st pregnancy, I had to be induced because I was having preeclampsia. They induced me on a Tuesday and I didn't get my baby till Thursday so I know how u feel. I wouldn't dilate, my water bag wouldn't burst, and I wasn't getting any contraction when they give me the pitocin. Eventually on Thursday, they came in and burst my water bag at 2:00 and by 7:10 my first born was here....
I don't understand why they sent u home though...
Hang in there dear! These babies have there own plans we just fall in line. Don't feel like a failure. I wish you well!
What?? Ive never heard of someone being sent home after pitocin.

Be glad they sent you home instead of giving up and doing a csection!! Go on some long walks! Doesn't have to be outside, you could go to a couple malls and store and baby shop! Make it fun! And you aren't a failure, even if you go in on Tuesday and you still don't have your baby naturally you are not a failure! Some women do not dilate! I never do! I went into labor with this one and they had to stop it but I never dilated! So keep your head up momma! Either way you are gonna have that beautiful baby!

I'm kinda happy they didn't do a c section cause I wanted a as natural as possible delivery. No epidural. So it does give him a chance to come on his own but I.just feel even more like I'm gonna be pregnant forever. They had up the pitocin to 24 and the highest was 30 and I only dilated to 2cm and had contractions 1 min apart but they didn't hurt too bad

question: After 14 hours of pitocion and nothing happening I'm going home. Coming back Tuesday and I'll be 41 weeks. Im so depressed. I thought for sure I would have my baby today and now I just feel like a failure :'(
title: failed induction
